abstracts.cdata!:
The overall objective of the State
            Pension Systems Reform Technical Assistance Project is to
            prepare the states technically to address pension reform and
            help them to move through the initial phases of reform. It
            is also to assist the Federal and Sate Governments to choose
            from among the best options and encourage them to implement
            sound reforms. State pension reform comprises four phases:
            (a) technical preparedness and diagnostic; (b) elaboration
            of pension reform proposals; (c) design of required
            institutional framework; and (d) implementation of reform
            proposals. The first project component addresses the
            adaptation of the Pension Reform Options Simulation Toolkit
            (PROST) to Brazilian reality. The second project component
            addresses the training of Federal and state employees in
            pension management and reform and in PROST through the
            support of consultants and workshops. The third project
            component addresses government activities, such as studies
            and dissemination of best case Pension fund management and
            Federal pension obligations and the design of an information
            system linking the Ministry of Social Security and Social
            Assistance with states' pension data bases.
